page.title: 01 INTRODUCTION
page.content: Our block is between the towns of Gravesend and Strood. Most of our area is farmland and orchards. There are two villages within the block, Higham and Shorne. During the past fifty years Higham has developed greatly as a residential area. Shorne, however, has fought to remain a small country village. In Higham there is a railway station which is used mainly by commuters. There are three old saxon churches in the area. In each village there is a primary school and also a village hall. Most people use Strood and Gravesend for shopping, though there are a number of local shops. In the last ten years the area has attracted a lot of commuters. The attraction of village life combined with the easy access to all facilities has made it a popular area to live.
